result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
No contact with BK, CS and JS.  Not to consume, use or possess any street drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Pay costs of supervision.  Follow all rules of supervision.  Undergo any programming as recommended by agent.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 09CF401 and 12CF339

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
/s/ 4-4-16
